TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is a former councillor of ORG . In DATE he lodged with ORG an application contesting ORG decision of DATE concerning the levying of local taxes and duties and the decision of CARDINAL DATE regarding the placement of outside advertisements in GPE , the presidential decree of CARDINAL DATE appointing the mayor and certain provisions of i ) the law of DATE concerning the date of local elections and the extension of the mandate of the councillors of local councils , ii ) the law of DATE concerning the local elections , iii ) the law of CARDINAL DATE concerning the local public administration , iv ) the law of DATE concerning the status of GPE and v ) the law of DATE concerning the status of a councillor in a local council . He alleged that the contested legal provisions contravened the LAW and ratified international instruments and that the unlawfully conducted municipal elections of DATE precluded him from freely exercising his right to participate in the administration of local public affairs . On DATE ORG dismissed as unfounded the application on the ground that his right to participate in the administration of local public affairs as a former councillor had not been interfered with as a result of the municipal elections and of the impugned acts . The applicant appealed against this decision , submitting that ORG had erroneously applied the material law and incorrectly dismissed his application . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal as unfounded referring to the reasoning of ORG . The applicant appealed against this decision , arguing that the inferior courts had disregarded the relevant provisions of the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights . On DATE ORG allowed the appeal , set aside ORG decision of DATE and sent the case back for re - examination to the same court . On DATE ORG dismissed as unfounded the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of ORG of DATE and upheld the latter decision .

The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision , arguing that ORG had erroneously applied procedural law and disregarded the relevant provisions of the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal after having found that ORG had conducted the proceedings in accordance with applicable procedural rules having due regard to the relevant provisions of the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights . On DATE ORG dismissed as unfounded the applicant ’s petition for annulment against of decision .

In DATE the applicant contested before ORG an official letter signed and addressed to him by a judge of ORG , explaining that the court lacked jurisdiction insofar as it concerned individual and collective petitions lodged by citizens directly with ORG . He argued that the said letter and the refusal of a judge of ORG to examine his application had infringed his constitutional right to have direct access to ORG . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint on the ground of its lack of jurisdiction , observing that jurisdiction in the matter lay with the competent district court . The applicant appealed against this decision , submitting that ORG had erroneously applied procedural law and incorrectly dismissed the application . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s initial application relying on the fact that the contested letter could not be classified as an administrative act and that therefore the courts lacked jurisdiction as regards the infringement of the applicant ’s rights he had complained of .

In DATE the applicant contested before ORG the actions and omissions of judges of ORG who had rejected his numerous complaints and letters in which he had challenged the constitutionality of certain legislative provisions and administrative decisions . He complained that the contested acts and omissions contravened the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights . On DATE ORG dismissed the application on the ground that the court lacked jurisdiction as regards the infringements of the applicant ’s rights he had complained of . The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision . On DATE ORG , relying on the same grounds as those stated in ORG decision , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . On DATE ORG dismissed as unfounded the applicant ’s petition for annulment of this decision .

In DATE the applicant contested before ORG the presidential decree of CARDINAL DATE appointing the mayor of PERSON and the presidential decree of CARDINAL DATE appointing ORG , alleging that the contested decrees contravened the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights and precluded him from freely exercising his right to vote and to be elected to ORG and to participate in the administration of local public affairs . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint on the ground of its lack of jurisdiction as regarded the alleged unconstitutionality of the above acts , observing that jurisdiction in the matter lay with ORG . The applicant appealed against this decision , arguing that ORG had failed to examine all the complaints contained in his application . On DATE ORG , referring to ORG reasoning , dismissed the appeal as unfounded .

Also in DATE the applicant contested before ORG the provisions of i ) LAW , ii ) the law of CARDINAL DATE concerning ORG , iii ) the LAW of constitutional jurisdiction of DATE and iv ) CARDINAL administrative acts of the ORG and its divisions . He alleged that the contested legal norms contravened the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights and precluded him from freely exercising his right to vote and to be elected to ORG and to participate in the administration of local public affairs . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint on the ground of its lack of jurisdiction as regarded the alleged unconstitutionality of the above acts , observing that jurisdiction in the matter lay with ORG . The applicant appealed against this decision , arguing that ORG had failed to examine all the complaints contained in his application . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of ORG of DATE and sent the case back for re - examination to the same court . On DATE ORG dismissed the initial application on the ground of its lack of jurisdiction , observing that the jurisdiction in the matter concerning the constitutionality of the challenged acts lay with ORG , while the competence concerning the electoral disputes lay with competent district court . On DATE ORG , relying on the same grounds as those stated in ORG decision of DATE , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the above decision .

In DATE the applicant contested before ORG TIME decisions of ORG concerning the preparation and carrying out of the electoral campaign for the parliamentary elections of DATE and the manner in which ORG had applied certain provisions of LAW . He argued that the contested acts and the manner in which they were applied contravened the relevant provisions of the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights and infringed his right to vote and to stand for the parliamentary elections . In particular , he complained that the threshold of PERCENT of the votes cast established for all candidates placed the independent candidates in a disadvantageous position as against other candidates ( e.g. political parties , blocks etc . ) . On DATE ORG dismissed the application on the ground that all the contested decisions had been adopted in accordance with the applicable provisions of LAW . In the same decision , the court ruled that it had had due regard to the relevant provisions of the ratified international instruments on human rights and that the applicant had failed to adduce prima facie evidence to prove that the contested acts had interfered with his right to vote and to stand for the parliamentary elections of DATE and dismissed as unfounded his complaint concerning the difference in treatment of the candidates . The applicant appealed against this decision , arguing that ORG had erroneously applied LAW and the rules of civil procedure , and had disregarded relevant provisions of the international instruments on human rights incorporated in the domestic legal order . On DATE the enlarged panel of ORG , relying on the same grounds as those stated in its decision of DATE , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .

In DATE the applicant lodged with ORG an application against the Government , ORG and CARDINAL ministries requesting the annulment of a joint decision of CARDINAL DATE of ORG imposing the levying of compulsory fees as a condition for exercising certain entrepreneurial activities . In the same application , he argued that the decision contravened the LAW and ratified international instruments on human rights and sought compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage caused to him as a result of the decision . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings on the ground of lack of jurisdiction in respect of the alleged unconstitutionality of the above decision , observing that jurisdiction lay with ORG .

The applicant appealed against this decision , submitting that the court had erroneously applied procedural law and incorrectly discontinued the proceedings . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment and sent the case back for re - examination to ORG on the ground that the applicant had failed to exhaust extra - judicial proceedings by contesting the decision before the administrative authority which had adopted the decision . On DATE ORG dismissed the initial application as inadmissible on the ground that , in the meantime , the above administrative decision had been declared unconstitutional by ORG and had been subsequently repealed by another administrative decision . The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision , arguing that his appeal had been dismissed as a result of the erroneous interpretation and application of the applicable provisions of civil procedure . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal , relying on the same grounds as those stated in the judgment of ORG of DATE . On DATE ORG dismissed as unfounded the applicant ’s petition for annulment of this decision .

Article CARDINAL provides that GPE is governed by the rule of law , where the dignity of people , their rights and freedoms , the open development of human personality , justice and political pluralism represent supreme values , which shall be guaranteed .
Under LAW , national sovereignty resides with the people of GPE , who shall exercise it directly and through its representative bodies in the ways provided for by LAW .

With regard to the human rights and freedoms , LAW states that the constitutional provisions for human rights and freedoms shall be understood and implemented in accordance with LAW , and with other conventions and treaties endorsed by GPE . Wherever disagreements appear between conventions and treaties signed by GPE and her own national laws , priority shall be given to international regulations .
Pursuant to LAW is the supreme law of the country , where no laws or other legal acts and regulations in contradiction with the provisions of the LAW may have any legal power .

As for the observance of international law and international treaties , in accordance with LAW pledges to respect LAW and the treaties to which it is a party , to observe with its relations with other GPE the unanimously recognised principles and norms of international law . The coming into force of an international treaty containing provisions contrary to the LAW shall be preceded by a revision of the latter .

Article PERSON provides that the exercise of certain rights or freedoms may be restricted only under the law and only as required in cases such as : the defence of national security , public order , health or morals , or ORG rights and freedoms , the carrying out of investigations in criminal cases , preventing the consequences of a natural calamity or of a technological disaster .

LAW final and transitional provisions provides that all ORG institutions in existence as of the date marking the coming into force of this LAW ( DATE ) retain their functionality until new institutions are established .

Pursuant to LAW NORP citizens shall have the right to participate in the administration of public affairs , either directly or through their representatives . Article CARDINAL further provides that the public administration governing in the administrative / territorial units is based on the principles of local autonomy , decentralisation of public services , eligibility of local public administration authorities and consultation of the citizens on local problems of special interest . With regard to village and town authorities , Article CARDINAL states that at village and town level , the public administration authorities through which local autonomy is exercised are represented by the elected local councils and mayors .

Article CARDINAL sets out the rights of persons aggrieved by public authority and provides , inter alia , that any person , whose rights have been interfered with in any way by public authority through an administrative ruling or a lack of timely legal reply to an application , is entitled to obtain acknowledgement of those rights , cancellation of the ruling and compensation of damages .

As to the fiscal system , pursuant to LAW , all taxes , duties , and other revenue of the national budget , including the national social security budget and the district , town and village budgets shall be established under the law by the representative agencies , as required .

Under LAW , the courts , in examining cases , shall apply the LAW , laws and the international treaties endorsed by GPE . The provisions concerning human rights and freedoms shall be applied in accordance with LAW . The same LAW states that a court shall not apply a law or any other normative act which contravene LAW .

As for the procedural aspects , pursuant to LAW , a judge may refuse to take for examination an action or application if the case is not liable to be examined by the courts or the court lacks jurisdiction in respect of that case .
Article CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the collegiate acts of the public administration and the individual acts of officials can be contested before the courts .

LAW states that every citizen has the right to obtain effective protection from competent courts against actions infringing his or her legitimate rights , freedoms and interests . LAW further provides that ORG is the sole authority of constitutional judicature in GPE and that it is independent of any other public authority and obeys only the LAW .

However , LAW DATE on ORG and LAW of DATE provide that the ORG shall exercise its constitutional jurisdiction only upon an appeal of the following subjects : a ) President ; b ) Government ; c ) Minister of ORG ; d ) ORG ; e ) ORG ; f ) Prosecutor General ; g ) Member of the ORG and h ) ORG faction .
Under LAW , laws and other regulations or parts thereof become null and void from the moment that FAC passes the appropriate decisions to that effect .

Article CARDINAL of LAW regulates the determination of the threshold of representation and states that upon receiving records of the voting results in all districts from all district electoral councils , ORG shall count the number of valid votes cast for each candidate in order to establish whether or not they have passed the PERCENT threshold of representation . Accordingly , candidates having obtained votes than PERCENT of the votes cast shall be excluded from assuming their Parliamentary mandates by a decision of ORG .
